Earlier this month, Democrats introduced a major legislative proposal to address the root causes of the Central American migrant crisis. We are ready to have a reasonable conversation on comprehensive immigration reform. Is @POTUS interested in solutions?

Abusing presidential trade powers rather than working on real solutions does not solve the problems driving families to seek refuge in the US and it does not improve our border policies. Let's start with updates to the bipartisan reform package that passed the Senate in 2013.

We could stem the flow of migrants fleeing violence by maintaining assistance to Central America. Contrary to @POTUS rhetoric, such programs would fund efforts to fight gangs, drug trafficking and corruption - the reason families are leaving their homes. https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/news-columns-blogs/andres-oppenheimer/article230164934.html …

Hurting our economy, American consumers and #smallbiz continues to be acceptable damage to @POTUS based on his efforts to keep immigration as a campaign theme rather than really solve the important issues. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/31/mnuchin-and-lighthizer-were-opposed-to-trump-tariffs-on-mexico-source-says.html …

As Special Counsel Mueller stated clearly today, the Constitution lays out Congress' responsibility to respond to both of these issues.

Key from Mueller today & report: (1) Intel officers who were part of the Russian military launched an attack on our political system. Release of info was timed to interfere with our election (2) "if we had confidence @POTUS clearly did not commit a crime, we would have said so"

We remember these men today and all those who made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation. Thank you to all those who served and all those who wear the uniform today.

during a patrol in the Khayr Kot district. Coming from a long line of military servicemen, Sergeant Campbell long dreamed of serving to carry on his family legacy. Sergeant Campbell is remembered by his friends and family as being a passionate and joyful person ...

On this #MemorialDay I also remember the sacrifice of Baltimore native Sergeant Damion G. Campbell. Sergeant Campbell, 23, was an army medic serving in Afghanistan and was killed in action on August 26, 2005 when a bomb exploded near his vehicle ...

William Bladen of College Park, Md., was a 19-yr-old paratrooper in the 82nd Airborne, who parachuted into Normandy during the D-Day invasion 75 yrs ago. He once said, “I hope people remember that a lot of men gave their lives for others.” I agree: Freedom isn’t free.#MemorialDay

This weekend, I will pray for the families in Maryland and across the United States who have lost loved ones defending our freedom. I will also pray for the safe return of those currently serving. #MemorialDay2019
These are freedoms that are too often taken for granted. The values that define our great nation came at the high price of American lives, and we are forever indebted to their service.

As you prepare for a relaxing weekend with your family, take time to honor the brave men and women in uniform who sacrificed everything for our country. Because of their incredible courage, we are able to speak, write, worship, vote and live the way we choose. #MemorialDay2019

It is unconscionable that the President of the United States might actively seek to end run Congress and prioritize arms sales and economic engagement over human rights.

US arms transfers should be provided only to countries that are demonstrably improving their efforts to protect the human rights and freedoms of their citizens and to promote participation and accountability in governance.

A majority in Congress has been clear about arms sales to Saudi Arabia at this time. US arms transfers should not be used to commit or facilitate violations of international humanitarian law in conflict zones... https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/22/politics/trump-murphy-saudi-arms-deal/index.html …

Our bipartisan Transportation Alternatives Enhancements Act will mean more trails, pedestrian and bike bridges, and other projects that connect communities to amenities. 40% of all trips in the U.S. are fewer than two miles, making bicycling a feasible and fun way to get to work.

I am proud to have introduced legislation with @SenatorWicker to support enhancements to the Transportation Alternatives program that would make it easier for local governments and agencies to fund and implement projects to strengthen our biking and walking infrastructure.

Riding your bike to work vs. driving can cut down household emissions by at least 6%

Bikes take fewer natural resources to make than cars -less energy for production/less rubber for tires

Average annual operating expense of a bike is just $308, versus $8,000 or more for a car

Kudos to everyone participating in #BikeToWorkDay and all the communities across Maryland participating in #BikeToWorkDay events. The number of bicycle commuters in the US has grown thanks to increased interest in healthy, sustainable and affordable transportation options.

America’s strength is in our values and protecting people who are in danger has always been an American value. Congress should work to advance bipartisan immigration legislation with or without the President’s help.

.@POTUS should work with Congress, based on the bipartisan bill that passed the Senate in 2013. Dems also have introduced comprehensive legislation to address the root causes of migration from Central America, while improving our asylum system and combating human trafficking.

The Senate already overwhelmingly rejected a similar proposal by a 39-60 vote last year. The Trump plan would waste more money on a border wall with Mexico, make it harder for families to reunify, and turn away refugees fleeing persecution in their home countries.

We all want highly skilled people in this country and we have done much to discourage that by our immigration policies. We should fix our immigration policies, but he extreme immigration plan that President Trump unveiled today is not a serious proposal.
I fundamentally disagree with @POTUS on his immigration policies, because he's trying to restrict the ability of good people to come to this country.

Actions of states, cities, colleges & businesses in Maryland and the entire U.S. economy demonstrate a resounding consensus: the time to act is now. @USChamber @ShopFloorNAM and others who work against climate action may be loud now, but their voice is being drowned out quickly.

I am asking these companies to rise to the challenge of climate change & lead the private sector. We have a small window to make an impact on the trajectory of global warming. We need to take seriously the threat of climate change to our infrastructure, national security & GDP.

Despite @POTUS, they have signed pledges like @WeAreStillIn as a sign to the intl community that pulling out of the Paris Climate Accord doesn't represent America’s position on climate or our values. These biz & 1000s others are standing firm in their support for a clean future.

.@USChamber @ShopFloorNAM have resisted climate action for years, even as many members invested in smart climate policies. Reality: some companies that serve on the board of NAM (@Intel @Microsoft #JNJ & others), @USChamber (@IBM) are striving to embrace sustainable practices.

They do not have the deep pockets to withstand climate-related extreme weather events. But they recognize the opportunity climate resilience presents — tremendous job creation and infrastructure development.

Many MD businesses support a clean energy future for America. This includes #smallbiz , many family-owned and operated, who understand the threat of climate change to their bottom line. They do not have the deep pockets to withstand climate-related extreme weather events.

How a community treats its women is a barometer of its success. Purposefully taking away women’s rights and putting their health at risk is moving in the wrong direction. #Alabama https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/14/politics/alabama-senate-abortion/index.html …

The American people -- American women -- deserve better than this.  I am committed to opposing these reckless and outrageous actions that will harm women and their families in Maryland and across our Nation.

The Trump Administration also has proposed a Title IX rule that weakens the existing protections for victims of campus sexual assault and allows universities to roll back their responsibilities to ensure students receive an education free of discrimination.

The Trump Administration finalized a rule that would bar providers from giving their patient complete medical information and block care at popular family planning providers like Planned Parenthood, even though Planned Parenthood serves approximately 40% of Title X patients.

One of the most egregious acts of this Administration is gutting Title X, the nation’s only federal grant program dedicated solely to providing individuals with comprehensive family planning and related preventive health services.

Women and their health care should not be under the constant attacks that they are today from the Trump Administration and congressional Republicans.  @CSPAN  https://www.c-span.org/video/?460698-2/senate-session-part-2 …

Patty, do you think he gets the irony in such a statement? President Trump has done everything possible to make health care less accessible and more expensive for women and families. https://twitter.com/PattyMurray/status/1128005907022077957 …
On #MothersDay let’s honor the mothers and all the women in our life by doing everything possible to lift women out of poverty. When women are educated and empowered, whole communities succeed.
On #MothersDay let’s honor the mothers and all the women in our life by taking action to pass sensible gun safety legislation. No mother should have to lose her child to such violence.

On #MothersDay let’s honor the mothers and all the women in our life by pledging to protect women’s health care. We cannot go back to when being a woman was treated as a pre-existing condition by insurance companies.
On #MothersDay let’s honor the mothers and all the women in our life by passing the Equal Rights Amendment. Most people are surprised to learn that equality is not in our constitution. #ERAnow

U.S. leaders have the power to save lives. Supporting peace and human rights makes America safer and more secure. But, by sustaining this veto, the people of Yemen lose faith in the U.S. and see the end to their suffering a little further out of reach.

Morally, continuing our military involvement in this disaster is simply not an option. Republicans and Democrats came together to pass Senate Joint Resolution 7.  For reasons that are still incomprehensible to me, the President chose to veto this resolution.

The suffering caused by this conflict is beyond measure.  More than 10,000 people have been killed and over 22.2 million people – nearly 75% of the population – are at grave risk. Hunger and malnutrition are threatening two million innocent children under the age of five.

This is unconscionable. The conflict in #Yemen has become a humanitarian nightmare and at this point our involvement does not advance the interests of the United States, our partners, or regional stability. https://twitter.com/MSNBC/status/1124020239128199174 …
We need to love thy neighbor – and respect their differences. In this way, we honor and do justice to the memory of the victims and survivors who we remember on #YomHaShoah
